Header: Thripitaka to be declared a national heritage tomorrow
Content: The declaration of ‘Thripitaka’, the sacred scripture of Buddhists, as a national heritage of Sri Lanka will be held tomorrow at the‘Aluvihara’ Temple in Matale. It will be held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena. The Government has called on the public to hoist the Buddhist flag tomorrow. The national ceremony marking the declaration of the Thripitaka as a national heritage will be held with the participation of 1500 honourable members of the Maha Sangha. The Government Information Department announced that the ceremony will be held under the full state sponsorship. The Sri Lankan Buddhists led by the members of the Maha Sangha safeguarded the Thripitaka for a period of more than 2300 years. The Secretary to the President has appealed to State Institutions and Vihares as well as the public to hoist the Buddhist flag tomorrow, the day the noble Thripitaka is to be officially declared as a national heritage.
